Modernization / Migrations
#### Shave months off major framework changes
Define your ideal state for software or teams, and use live feeds from connected tools to track progress against any dimension. Target alerts to only those developers that need to take action to bring software or actions into alignment, speeding transition time.
![](https://cortex.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fa-us.storyblok.com%2Ff%2F1021527%2F991x912%2F449f76d77b%2Fhome_acc_02.png&w=3840&q=99)
3
Production Readiness
#### Set standards and stay aligned
Define production requirements for services, resources, APIs, models, and more. Supply templates to reduce risk and time to code, and track on-going alignment to standards with real-time scorecards and reporting that devs can also monitor themselves.
![](https://cortex.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fa-us.storyblok.com%2Ff%2F1021527%2F991x912%2F37b76bedc7%2Fhome_acc_03.png&w=3840&q=99)
4
Incident Response
#### Find owners, fix faster
On-call information is only as good as ownership information, accessibility of context, and presence of runbooks. Ensure always-up-to-date ownership and enforce incident preparedness best practice to centralize critical information and cut response time.
![](https://cortex.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fa-us.storyblok.com%2Ff%2F1021527%2F991x912%2Fae7bddc09a%2Fhome_acc_04.png&w=3840&q=99)
5
Self - Service
#### Unlock self-service that stays on the rails
Make it easy for developers to build better from the start, without slowing them down. Software scaffolding, workflow automations, and one-click approvals ensure consistency across teams while reducing rote work for developers that need to move quickly.
![](https://cortex.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fa-us.storyblok.com%2Ff%2F1021527%2F991x912%2F6660c4e481%2Fhome_acc_05.png&w=3840&q=99)
6
Backstage Migration
#### Ditch the chaos, keep your catalogs
Define workflows that spin up accounts and allocate secrets. Make it easy to find information about anything. And make action obvious.
![](https://cortex.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fa-us.storyblok.com%2Ff%2F1021527%2F990x912%2F1e9da7eff4%2Fhome_acc_06.png&w=3840&q=99)

Information access is the first step towards a positive developer experience. Cortex abstracts away the work required to connect all your tools so developers spend less time finding and fixing, and more time building—no matter how complex your platform gets.

### A true engineering system of record
To ensure adoption, your IDP must model data in a way that matches business logic. Cortex does the heavy lifting of that process for you, while preserving the customization you need. 
![](https://a-us.storyblok.com/f/1021527/20x20/bb83225d26/listchecks.svg)
### Always-on standards that stick
Passive software standards get ignored. Continuously assess software and teams for progress towards your ideal state. Build via GUI or GitOps—no custom scripts required.
![](https://cortex.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fa-us.storyblok.com%2Ff%2F1021527%2F20x20%2F304190d219%2Fsharenetwork2.png&w=48&q=90)
### Self-service that stays on the rails
Eliminate toil without losing track. Centralize developer workflows across other tools, and add one-click templates and approvals to keep gates from becoming bottlenecks.

#### What are Internal Developer Portals?
Internal Developer Portals (IDPs) are the engineering system of record. They use connections to all tooling to provide golden paths for new software builds, and ensure continuous alignment to standards of excellence.From services and APIs to Kubernetes clusters and data pipelines—IDPs eliminate “swivel chair” for devs by centralizing the information they need to build, deploy, and maintain healthy software. LetsGetChecked, BigCommerce, and Grammarly see results like decreased incident frequency and duration, and increased in deployment velocity with Cortex's IDP.

**Cortex: A Brief Overview**

Founded in 2019 and hailing from the heart of San Francisco, Cortex is redefining the developer experience by introducing an Internal Developer Portal (IDP) that eliminates what’s often referred to as the “developer tax.” As a part of Y Combinator’s Winter 2020 batch, Cortex has quickly established itself as an essential tool for engineering teams at notable companies including Docker, TripAdvisor, and Dropbox.

**Mission and Vision**

At its core, Cortex aims to accelerate the path to engineering excellence. The platform helps organizations streamline complex workflows and removes barriers that inhibit productivity. It does this by providing a comprehensive cataloging system that allows teams to score and assign tasks, thereby improving service quality and enhancing velocity.

**How It Works**

Cortex operates on a systematic approach to optimize engineering operations: it connects various tools and systems, assesses current processes, drives actionable insights, builds upon existing frameworks, and measures outcomes. This cycle not only enhances awareness of ownership and software states but also facilitates agile, informed decision-making.

**Key Features and Benefits**

- **Developer Onboarding:** Automates tedious onboarding processes, getting new developers ramped up quicker.
- **Software Modernization:** Helps in efficiently tracking transitions during significant software framework changes.
- **Production Readiness:** Sets clear production standards for services and ensures ongoing alignment with real-time scorecards.
- **Incident Response:** Cuts down response time by maintaining up-to-date ownership information and best practice guidelines.

The measurable benefits of adopting Cortex are noteworthy. Organizations report increased developer productivity, reduced mean time to restore (MTTR), and faster migration times. The platform stands out by providing clear ROI metrics that matter—like deployment frequency and service level objective (SLO) attainment.

**Team and Culture**

With a team of 100 focused on delivering seamless developer experiences, Cortex operates under a culture that fundamentally understands the nuanced needs of engineering teams. Supported by its Group Partner Jared Friedman, the company remains agile and innovative.

Their commitment to developer satisfaction and operational excellence fosters strong relationships with clients, leading to productive partnerships and continuous growth.
